alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 21 at 7:24PM CDT until August 21 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... Northwestern El Paso County in western Texas... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 624 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over West El Paso. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 7 and 26. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Mission Valley, Santa Teresa, Sunland Park, Fort Bliss, Biggs Field and Franklin Mountains State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
